metadata.title: Archives of Virology Protein Synthesis in Cells Infected by Murine Hepatitis Viruses JHM and A 59: Tryptie Peptide Analysis

abstract.original_text: The structural and intracellular proteins of the murine hepatitis viruses MHV-JHM and MHV-A59 were studied by tryptic peptide mapping. The results demonstrated that the virions contained three distinct proteins: the two related chains of the E2 complex, the nucleocapsid protein and the heterogeneous E1 complex. Five distinct virus-specific proteins were synthesized by infected cells. Three of the five intracellular proteins contained tryptic-peptides with properties similar to the three structural proteins. Models describing the evolution of the proteins are proposed. Although the pathogenic properties of MHV-JttM and MHV-A59 differ greatly, the tryptic peptide maps of the corresponding proteins of these MHV strMns were remarkably similar. 334 C.W. BOND, K. A~VD~,~SON, and J. L. LEIBOWITZ: at least seven virus-specific RNA species that function as mRNAs (12, 13, 20, 22) . Five of the seven mRNAs have been translated in vitro and coding assignments have been made (13, 20) .

sentences.segment_text: The structural and intracellular proteins of the murine hepatitis viruses MHV-JHM and MHV-A59 were studied by tryptic peptide mapping .
The results demonstrated that the virions contained three distinct proteins : the two related chains of the E2 complex ,
the nucleocapsid protein and the heterogeneous E1 complex .
Five distinct virus-specific proteins were synthesized by infected cells .
Three of the five intracellular proteins contained tryptic-peptides with properties similar to the three structural proteins .
Models describing the evolution of the proteins are proposed .
Although the pathogenic properties of MHV-JttM and MHV-A59 differ greatly ,
the tryptic peptide maps of the corresponding proteins of these MHV strMns were remarkably similar .
334 C.W. BOND , K. A ~ VD ~ ,
~ SON , and J. L. LEIBOWITZ : at least seven virus-specific RNA species that function as mRNAs ( 12 , 13 , 20 , 22 ) .
Five of the seven mRNAs have been translated in vitro and coding assignments have been made ( 13 , 20 ) .

abstract.original_text: Five to nine virus-specific proteins have been identified in cells infected by MHV-JHM, MHV-A59 or MHV-3 (1, 3, 5, 18, 21) . The virus-specific proteins were identified by comparison of immunoprecipitates of infected and mock-infected cell lysates with purified virions by SDS-polyacryIamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE). STURMAN (26) proposed a model for the structure of MHV-A59. Three structural proteins were described; the nucleocapsid phosphoprotein (N), the transmembrane gtycoprotein (El) and the peplomerie glycoprotein complex (E 2), which consists of two related proteins.

sentences.segment_text: Five to nine virus-specific proteins have been identified in cells infected by MHV-JHM ,

The virus-specific proteins were identified by comparison of immunoprecipitates of infected and mock-infected cell lysates with purified virions by SDS-polyacryIamide gel electrophoresis ( SDS-PAGE ) .
STURMAN ( 26 ) proposed a model for the structure of MHV-A59 .
Three structural proteins were described ; the nucleocapsid phosphoprotein ( N ) ,
the transmembrane gtycoprotein ( El ) and the peplomerie glycoprotein complex ( E 2 ) ,
which consists of two related proteins .

abstract.original_text: SIDDELL (19) analyzed the structural and intracellular proteins of MHV-JHYI by tryptic peptide mapping of ssS-methionine-labeled proteins. The results indicated that six distinct virus-specific proteins were synthesized by infected cells during the acute infection. The virus particles contained four of these proteins.

sentences.segment_text: SIDDELL ( 19 ) analyzed the structural and intracellular proteins of MHV-JHYI by tryptic peptide mapping of ssS-methionine-labeled proteins .
The results indicated that six distinct virus-specific proteins were synthesized by infected cells during the acute infection .
The virus particles contained four of these proteins .

abstract.original_text: WEiss and LEIBOWITZ (31) demonstrated by molecular hybridization that the genomes of MHV strains JHM and A59 are closely related in sequence. The molecular weights of the MHV-JHM and MHV-A 59 proteins are similar by SDS-PAGE (2, 3), yet the pathogenic properties of these two viruses are strikingly different (15, 17). In this communication we present tryptic peptide maps of MHV-JHM and MHV-A59 proteins.

The molecular weights of the MHV-JHM and MHV-A 59 proteins are similar by SDS-PAGE ( 2 , 3 ) ,
yet the pathogenic properties of these two viruses are strikingly different ( 15 , 17 ) .
In this communication we present tryptic peptide maps of MHV-JHM and MHV-A59 proteins .
